attributes.action: All infrastructure projects be tested against the Net Zero Emissions 2050 Law
attributes.background: Ensure that all current and future infrastructure projects as part of Budget 2020 and beyond are rigorously tested against the Net Zero Emissions 2050 law. Sustainable and low carbon projects should then be prioritised including renewable energy and mass public transit.
attributes.additional_details:
The evidence that we are in the midst of a global climate emergency is obvious, the science is obvious. But more than that we can see the impact of climate change every day from floods, to bush fires, Greenland and Antarctica ice melting faster than ever, to the decline in biodiversity. This is not a drill, we need real leadership and we need it now. 

This government speaks about the people's priorities and surely the biggest priority for everyone is a planet that is safe to live on.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Help the Rohingya refugees by pressuring Bangledeshi Government
attributes.background: So the United Nations’ may undertake a prior independent technical and protection assessment of Bhasan Char and review the sustainability and environmental conditions on the island. Bangledeshi Government to permit unfettered humanitarian access to Bhasan Char by relevant human rights organisations.
attributes.additional_details: The challenging conditions of Bangladeshi Cox's Bazar (where the Rohingya refugees fled from systemic persecution and violence in Myanmar) does not justify the decision to shift over 100,000 refugees to Bhasan Char, an unsuitable, formerly uninhabited, remote island; in effect a detention camp. An inhumane decision and a deprivation of the human rights of the Rohingya. Lack of medical care and humanitarian aid, serious environmental issues will result in suffering and oppression of the Rohingya.

attributes.action: Funded and sustainable mental health support networks for BAME communities.
attributes.background: As of current, there is little to no specific mental health support for BAME individuals. BAME communities can face discrimination in every part of life; from racist attacks to prejudice, not to mention systemic racism, and as a result, the mental health of many BAME individuals suffer.
attributes.additional_details: The Government has a duty to set up and financially support systems and networks that benefit the mental health of BAME individuals. Stable mental health is the foundation of a happy and fulfilling life; we know that with good mental health, drug usage decreases, which almost always sees a decrease in crime rate, which in turn benefits our neighborhoods and boroughs. The Government, therefore, has a responsibility to set up funded and sustainable BAME mental health support networks and systems.

departments.name: Department of Health and Social Care

attributes.action: Increase the sentence for Racist Hate Crime from 6 months to minimum 5 years
attributes.background: Increase the sentences for the offence of improper use of a public communication network if it’s a racist hate crime from 6 months to 5 years. There is currently no statutory aggravated form of this offence to take into account racist motivations.
attributes.additional_details:
Introduce minimum fines of £5,000 per instance. Consider adding the removal of all Social Media access for anyone found guilty of online Racist Hate Crime. Relaunch the CPS guidelines for said crimes using SocMedia
 
The recent online abuse of several English football players, following the penalty shoot-out in the Euro 2020 final was to me, sickening. I feel strongly that there is not enough of a deterrent for offenders and equally not enough visibility of what punishments are likely to be given if found guilty. I believe there is an appetite for the people of this country to stand up and make a difference. I believe this petition will act as a spark to ignite the flame of effective and sustainable change.

attributes.action: Pay a £2,500 bonus to all NHS employees.
attributes.background:
The Government have paid Furlough payments of up to £2.5k a month per person to sustain people though the pandemic for over a year.

The Government have just announced a pay rise of 1% to NHS staff which barely covers inflation.

Please pay each of them a similar amount as a bonus
attributes.additional_details:
All NHS staff have been working all though the pandemic and put themselves at enormous risk by exposure to the disease, I would like to suggest that the Government pay a one-off bonus to all NHS staff to the same value as the monthly Furlough payments of £2.5k

This would demonstrate to the NHS the high regard we all hold them in and give some appreciation to them for their efforts in the last year.

departments.name: Department of Health and Social Care

attributes.action: Ban the advertising of products which are not plant-based and cruelty-free
attributes.background: In the interest of the health of our people, our planet and the exploitation of animals, the Government should ban all advertising of all food, drink, health/beauty, household and clothing products which are not plant-based and cruelty free, including their packaging.
attributes.additional_details:
With COP26 in November 2021, we have to start viewing these types of products in a similar way as we do tobacco.

This ban would not prevent the sale of these products but would make them less attractive. Additionally, this ban would incentivise organisations into producing their products in a much more sustainable way and/or consider plant-based/cruelty free alternatives.

By making these changes, organisations could then take full advantage of the benefits of a multi channel marketing campaign.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Require outdoor venues to rent take-away cups to customers by deposit only.
attributes.background: Food and drink establishments should be banned from giving customers single use plastic to take-away. If people were given cups, with an enforced deposit charge, this would give them incentive to return the items. This would clear up the beaches and streets as well as being far more sustainable.
attributes.additional_details: Every morning the beaches and streets are littered with plastic cups that are given to customers by bar staff. The drinking establishments don't take any responsibility for this and the council have to pay to have the beaches cleaned. A lot of this plastic ends up in the sea before the council clear it up. Enforcing deposits for take away items has already been successfully adopted by festivals around the world and something has to be done about the litter problem we have here in the UK.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Exempt first and second generation migrants from inheritance tax.
attributes.background: To allow first and second generation migrants to be exempted from inheritance tax so as they are able to  provide generational wealth for thier families and future generations.
attributes.additional_details: To encourage a better level playing field for first and second generation families to sustain their wealth and achievements and to be able to support and empower their children and families as futuregenerations.  I believe this will help to create a better standard of life for future generations and be a fair and just action to take.

attributes.action: Refuse Dairy Industry Bailouts: Transition to a Plant-Based Food System
attributes.background:
The Royal Association of Dairy Farmers and NFU have called for a government bailout of the dairy industry. 

We ask the Government to not bailout the dairy industry and instead financially support farmers by investing in a nationwide transition to a sustainable and just plant-based food system.
attributes.additional_details:
The dairy industry is a contributor to climate breakdown  and ecosystem collapse.

The dairy industry is responsible for killing millions of animals globally every year. 

The dairy industry uses large amounts of land, preventing the UK from growing enough food to be food secure.

A plant-based food system could greatly improve all of these issues.

attributes.action: Ban the burning of peat for fuel
attributes.background: The government should ban the use of peat as fuel. Instead, the government should support the development of sustainable energy sources. Peatlands should be protected from harvesting for any reason, not just for horticulture.
attributes.additional_details: The recent announcement to ban peat in horticulture is a positive step for protecting peatlands. But a significant proportion of peat is harvested for use as fuel to burn. This still results in peatlands being destroyed and increases carbon emissions.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Offer assistance, asylum and support to those fleeing Iran.
attributes.background: The risk of persecution, execution and oppression for women, children and men in Iran is resulting in a continued growth in displaced or at risk populations.
attributes.additional_details: The UK Government can offer support, asylum and protection to those at risk. The Iranian people are highly educated, hard working and desperate for change. Many have families around the world, especially in the UK, but are unable to safely, or sustainable seek refuge in the UK. 11,300 Afghans have been granted Indefinite Leave to Remain, through the bespoke visa schemes set up for them. The systems and processes exist we just lack the will to act. We have the opportunity to meaningfully act now.

attributes.action: Rid the roads of pot holes and damage, reducing accidents and damage to cars
attributes.background: Provide financial assistance to local councils and highways to repair roads immediately when reported. Insist that a more sustainable repair is made and not just filled in temporarily.
attributes.additional_details: The government has a duty of care to all road users ensuring safety and protecting our vehicles. Road tax is paid by all road users, and council tax is paid towards local government to assist with these issues. A government contingency plan would help when local government overspend within their financial year.

attributes.action: Implement the proposed ban on new petrol and diesel car sales from 2030
attributes.background: The Government have proposed banning sales of new fossil-fuel powered cars from 2030. That's a necessary and achievable step against the climate crisis. Many drivers who have switched to an electric vehicle, or are considering doing so, wish to show their support for this.
attributes.additional_details:
Banning new ICE car sales from 2030 will not force anyone to scrap an older or classic car overnight.
 
At least one petition opposing this sensible change is live, and is based on the flawed argument that "electric cars are nowhere near as economic as diesel and petrol cars".
 
The signatories of this petition want to express support for a proposal that is sensible, reasonable and desperately needed as a step towards a sustainable climate.

attributes.action: Impose a fit and proper persons test for social care companies
attributes.background: The Government should impose a 'fit and proper persons test', like that used by HMRC to assess the suitability of those working in the charity sector, to ensure that only reputable individuals are allowed to own and operate social care services.
attributes.additional_details: This should help to ensure that these services are operated sustainably, that clients are suitably cared for, and that employees' rights are better protected.

departments.name: Department of Health and Social Care

attributes.action: Impose a corporation tax surcharge on companies that produce single-use plastics
attributes.background: Impose a corporation tax surcharge on companies that produce single-use plastics, based on the cost of removing plastic waste from the environment. The worst offenders would pay the highest surcharges, which would act as an incentive to change their behaviour.
attributes.additional_details: Every year billions of single-use plastic bottles and plastic packaging are bought across the UK, most ending up in landfill sites and in the oceans, causing damage to wildlife and resulting in microplastics that pollute the food chain. It can take upwards of 450 years for a single plastic bottle to degrade and so the problem is one that is going to affect future generations. It’s about time the Government took this problem seriously and showed they are serious about sustainability.

attributes.action: Impose a levy on all plastic production in the UK
attributes.background: I want the Government to impose a levy on plastic production to cover the cost of tidying our land and sea of the unsightliness and dangers of plastic pollution. Our bodies, wildlife, waterways, towns and countryside are awash with non-recyclable, non-biodegradable plastic and plastic particles.
attributes.additional_details: Evidence shows that plastics are not easily reusable or recyclable or biodegradable. A levy is needed to pay for the damage and mess of plastic pollution and incentivise producers to move to more sustainable practices. The amount imposed needs to be enough to mount a demonstrably effective and ongoing clean-up operation, and act as a financial disincentive to continued production.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Ban the importation of wood pellets used for the generation of electricity.
attributes.background: Importation of wood pellets should be banned and the use in power stations should be urgently reviewed. Burning of wood pellets must not be considered sustainable or a means of meeting net zero targets. Billions of UK green subsidies into this technology must stop.
attributes.additional_details: Using wood pellets releases more CO2 than burning coal. Because the government considers wood pellets as a renewable resource, by re-planting trees, the emissions are classed as carbon neutral and “helps” to get closer to the neutral target in 2030. This is not the case. Deforestation is happening around the world to supply the UK with wood pellets for burning, which generates around 11% of our energy needs. British taxpayers are funding this destruction of forests.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Seek to improve the safety and ecological-soundness of pesticide use globally
attributes.background: I would like the Government to work internationally to seek to reduce and remedy use of harmful pesticides globally. Some pesticides can be bad for our health, the environment and economy - they affect wildlife and cause health issues. The UK and its partners can start to improve practices.
attributes.additional_details: The Government should work with other countries to put pesticide use on an ecological footing. This should include influence through trade deals, to agree world standards to create a healthier and more sustainable economy. Some pesticides increase the risks of cancers and foetal abnormalities. Crop pollinating is worth up to $600 billion globally and insects are important to our gardens and natural spaces. Our human needs are met by natural resources. We need others to accept this.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Ban the advertising and endorsement of Internal Combustion Engine Vehicles.
attributes.background:
The advertising of Internal Combustion Engines should be banned.
 
This should include a ban on "endorsement" – meaning a company/organisation/business/celebrity/other cannot sponsor/advertise or put its/their name/logo on a vehicle with an Internal Combustion Engine.
attributes.additional_details:
Pollutants from Internal combustion engines (petrol/diesel vehicles) on your country’s roads are having detrimental effects on your health and those around you.

Help stop glorifying that which kills men, women and children every year!

One step closer towards a cleaner, greener, more sustainable future!
See also; Clean Air Strategy 2019 

Advertising only for alternatively fuelled, zero emission vehicles of all types/modes of transport.

attributes.action: Ban the advertisement of plastic and non-recyclable toys to children
attributes.background: Regulate which kinds of products can be advertised directly to children (e.g. during kids TV Ad Breaks) to ensure that items made from plastic and non-recyclable materials are not advertised to children.
attributes.additional_details: Plastics are a major part of climate crisis. They can take thousands of years to break down, polluting our environment especially our oceans. When we are actively trying to move towards a greener & more sustainable society it makes no sense to continue heavily promoting plastic toys to our children. If these ads were banned there would be an incentive for this industry to use more sustainable alternatives to produce their products & packaging, the next generation should be encouraged away from plastic.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: For the british government to financially help British nationals stuck abroad
attributes.background: To put in place a monthly financial packages to help British nationals who become stuck or trapped abroad in a foreign country due to unforseen circumstances which helps them sustain and maintain their basic living needs
attributes.additional_details: This is because there is no financial help given to British nationals stuck abroad who get caught up in difficulties and unforseen circumstances due to pandemics, natural disasters, terrorism etc

attributes.action: Tax disposable nappies & use the money to give parents a reusables starter kit.
attributes.background: Disposable nappies are currently zero rated for VAT. If instead a tax were added and the money raised used to fund a reusable starter pack of nappies for babies in the UK this could encourage parents to use reusable nappies thereby reducing landfill, ocean plastics and climate change.
attributes.additional_details: The UK disposes of 3 billion disposable nappies each year, which represents an estimated 2-3% of all household waste. It is estimated a single baby uses between 4000 and 6000 nappies by the time they are potty trained. The majority of these nappies are not biodegradable and are placed into household waste so go into landfill which is a major environmental concern. We urgently need action to address climate change and this could massively reduce landfill and encourage more sustainability.

attributes.action: Impose high import tariffs on goods not certified as sustainably sourced
attributes.background: The UK government should place high import taxes on goods derived from activities which damage the environment e.g. Brazilian animal feed, wood, meat from land which was previously rainforest, the destruction of which threatens significant environmental changes with dire global consequences.
attributes.additional_details:
Environmental destruction should not be profitable. When we buy the products of environmental damage we encourage and perpetuate the problem.
 
To shift U.K. consumption to sustainable activities we should make it expensive to import items, the creation of which threatens our safety due to the damage it has made to our environment.
 
When we stop paying for goods produced through activities which destroy the planet, these activities will stop.

attributes.action: Commit to electrification of the whole East West Rail line & ban diesel on route
attributes.background: Place the environment and sustainable transport at the forefront of the East West Rail project and commit to ensuring that the whole of the project is electrified at the outset and that diesel cannot be used to fuel trains along the entire route.
attributes.additional_details:
“Electric trains are better for the environment than diesel trains, and they’re quieter for both those on board ... and those living close to the railway" (Network Rail who are undertaking significant work to electrify rails to meet the government's target of taking all diesel only trains off the track by 2040)

Failure to commit to this now risks severe disruption to the local habitats and communities not once but twice before the end of the next decade as well as decreasing air quality.

attributes.action: Create laws for what can/cant be classed as sustainable to prevent greenwashing
attributes.background: I would like the government to take action and design laws that lay out clear definitions for what can/cant be classed as sustainable that companies will have to meet before claiming to be sustainable. This is so that consumers can make informed choices when shopping and to prevent greenwashing.
attributes.additional_details:
Greenwashing is rife in brand campaigns, climate change is on a lot of peoples minds and consumers want to make choices when shopping that are better for the planet however when brands claim to be sustainable with no guidelines, rules or laws to regulate what can and cant be classed as sustainable they are misleading consumers with buzzwords. 

The government should take the leading steps to create these laws so we can protect both the planet and consumers from making misinformed decisions.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Fund initiatives to recycle PPE waste
attributes.background: The pandemic has completely reshaped our priorities, we have become dependant on the use of PPE to protect ourselves from the dangers posed by Covid 19. How this PPE is discarded however poses a significant threat to the environment and our climate. The Government must enable recycling of PPE.
attributes.additional_details: In response to this, I propose the Government provide funding for PPE recycling schemes, with facilities made available for public use. This could include PPE recycling positioned outside a variety of supermarkets in the UK. This would better enable a return from this pandemic sustainably. The government can make real change in enabling the country to better dispose of its PPE.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Increase tax on private flights
attributes.background: Significantly increase taxes on private flights, to discourage use of private flights and to encourage use of more sustainable and less environmentally damaging modes of transport.
attributes.additional_details: Do this to help protect the environment by  promoting positive behaviour to reduce carbon emissions to address the climate change emergency.

attributes.action: Retain full benefits for parents facing temporary removal of their children
attributes.background: Currently, parents who have children temporarily removed by children's social care face sanctions in their benefits. This is an additional and unnecessary burden on parents attempting to get their children returned to them. Benefits should remain fixed until final arrangements for children are made.
attributes.additional_details: Poverty is endemic and impacts the lives of millions of families in the UK. Additional financial hardship for parents who have had their children temporarily removed by children's services is unfair and counterproductive to the principles of always seeking reunification for children with their birth families. This must change systemically to give all parents a fairer chance to create and sustain environments to support their children returning to them.

attributes.action: Abolish or reduce immigration fees for Commonwealth Service Personnel
attributes.background: I would like the Government to abolish or reduce existing immigration fees for Commonwealth Personnel to stay in the UK, which are currently almost £2,500. The Government should either scrap these fees or at the very least give a 50% discount in recognition of their service to this country.
attributes.additional_details: Commonwealth service personnel pay the ultimate price in-service. if they are unable to pay these exorbitant Visa fees to regularise their stay after their discharge, including medical discharge, they face being deported. We believe this affects their fundamental human rights as some of them may have sustained injuries or raised families here, and being made to leave the country could mean access to less good health services, and ending up losing their lives and families.

attributes.action: Fund organic food production to reduce cost
attributes.background: Organic food is more expensive than non-organic food. This means that only richer people can afford to eat healthy organic food. In order to increase health and sustainable practices the Government should make organic food cheaper.
attributes.additional_details:
Non-organics use pesticides which are environmental pollutants, use fertilizers (polluting water systems) and degrade top soil. 
 
Agroecology and organic food production do the opposite.
 
The Government should increase funding for organic food production, so that this becomes cheaper than non-organics, and more accessible to all irrespective of income.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Reallocate the £350 million from the NTP to schools to support pupils directly
attributes.background: Schools are best place to support their pupils - the National Tutoring Programme will fail to do this effectively and waste public money. If this money was given to schools, it could be used effectively to support families directly and in a holistic and long term sustainable way.
attributes.additional_details: The money is an excellent opportunity to invest in the services schools provide, but will be wasted if it goes to private tutoring companies that may not be invested in the children or communities they serve in the way that schools do.

attributes.action: Replace nuclear power with hybrid-solar-battery power in the energy strategy
attributes.background: We the undersigned, want the government to replace monolithic, stagnating nuclear power in the energy strategy with roof-based, modular, sustainable, rapidly evolving hybrid-solar-battery systems and insulation for all social-housing. Batteries will supply baseload power when the sun doesn’t shine.
attributes.additional_details: Installing hybrid-solar-battery systems and insulation for about 4 million social-houses could immediately add an ever-increasing capacity each year, taking less than 5 years to reach full capacity. The power costs less than £44/MWh and could provide over 16 TW baseload per year which could replace about half of current Russian gas energy imports. It could create about 50 thousand long-term service jobs and take-up no extra land. It produces zero pollution from free UK sunlight and, year-on-year, drives down unit costs to grow our green industries and generate more tax revenue. The government could reduce benefits in line with about 50% energy savings in social-housing households to recoup the capital investment in as little as 6 years.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Make 5% deposit mortgage guarantee scheme available only to first-time buyers
attributes.background: The Budget 2021 had a scheme for all buyer to get mortgage guarantee for any property (new/old which is a good news). But, this should be only for first time buyer.
attributes.additional_details:
The Government is helping people to reach the property leader, but the current policy will create further competition between "buy to let" buyers and "first time buyers”.
 
Increasing availability of mortgages to potential buyers could increase property value (sustain the market). People who already have a property and wanted to invest the money in "buy to let" will be happy. Whereas first-time buyers may suffer if property value goes up.
 
Restricting this scheme to first-time buyers will help enable more people reach the property ladder, without increasing competition with existing homeowners or risking inflating property values.

attributes.action: Ban the import of goods that have not been certified as sustainably sourced
attributes.background: The Government should ban the import of goods that are not sustainably sourced, such as those that contribute to deforestation and habitat destruction. This would pressure companies to become more sustainable. Products should need to be certified as sustainably sourced to be imported.
attributes.additional_details:
More than 150 acres of rainforest are lost every minute. We contribute when we buy from a company whose products result in forests being cleared to produce things like palm oil. Often, we do not have control or we don’t know.
 
If the government puts pressure on companies, they will change their practices. We know this because, after the ban of ozone-destroying CFCs, companies found alternatives quickly. We urge the government to take action before damage done to the biodiversity of our planet becomes irreversible.

attributes.action: Require local authorities provide free recycling services for schools
attributes.background: It should be compulsory for all local authorities in England to provide schools with free plastic, metal, and paper recycling services. Too many schools are sending their recyclable waste to landfill along with their general waste, because they do not have access to free recycling services.
attributes.additional_details: According to Flexible Storage Solutions, the average primary school student in produces about 45kg of waste per year, and the average secondary school student is responsible for 22kg. The Department of Education's Sustainability and Climate Change strategy outlines that by 2025, it will eradicate single-use plastics, and encourage the use of reusable and recyclable materials in schools, but if schools don't have access to free recycling services, we believe this target will not be met.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Provide funding for greater holistic dementia care after the covid-19 pandemic.
attributes.background: Provide funding for the health and social care sector so that the funds can provide holistic homecare therapy such as active minds, befriending and a wellbeing device from external services in addition to other home care.
attributes.additional_details: Since covid-19 dementia care at home has been one of the hardest things to sustain without negative effect upon the person diagnosed and the carers, it is usually acted upon out of moral duty, the aim is to provide a bridge in the gap between homecare, holistic therapy and external agency, funding needs to be provided to local authorities to use at their discretion to external agency who can provide validated Holistic engaging therapy

departments.name: Department of Health and Social Care

attributes.action: Require use of Sustainable Aviation Fuels (SAFs) and increase taxes on non-SAFs
attributes.background: The UK should pass a law requiring all aircraft operating in the UK use Sustainable Aviation Fuels (SAFs). The share of SAFs required should rise annually, reaching the maximum allowed by 2030. Simultaneously, non-SAF fuel should be taxed at a growing rate to ensure it is costlier than SAFs by 2030.
attributes.additional_details:
SAFs are made from sustainable sources. A variety of SAFs are licensed for use in current planes. They can reduce the net CO2 impact of flying, but they cost more than fossil jet fuel, so demand & production are still low. That is why Government intervention is needed to accelerate progress by assuring growing demand.
 
For sustainability and ethical reasons, only SAFs which don't compete with food production or cause deforestation, and which are not sourced from animals, should be promoted.

attributes.action: Set a 5-year plan to lead the UK to self-sustainability, less reliance on others
attributes.background:
Create new targets to be achieved over a 5 year span of time, to lead the UK to increase its self suitability, and rely less on imports from other nations. In terms of agriculture, energy, medicines etc.
Also work to increase the science and engineering sectors of this nation.
attributes.additional_details: Brexit has lead us to see that without a deal we will struggle, with increasing prices, and so by increasing our own suitability, we would be able to tackle many issues. By promoting our science and engineering sectors we could become far more sustainable as well as increase our own exports to back up the economy.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy
Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Create an alternative education provision for neuro-diverse children and teens
attributes.background: Create an outside, farmstead type alternative to conventional education with a focus on vocational and life skills. Teaching children to grow, harvest and prepare their own food. Basic English and maths onsite and therapeutic interventions where necessary. Focus on environment and sustainability.
attributes.additional_details: Proactive strategy to avoid the sudden increase in SEMH difficulties in neurodiverse children and teens who are misunderstood and as such treated as 'undesirables' leading to plummeting self esteem and a need for connection (often found though crime or drugs). A community based approach where everyone is 'understood', strengths and success are the focus and practical 'outside the box' thinking is celebrated and nurtured. Some of our most successful entrepreuneurs have ADHD but the amount of children I see, as SenCo, hit rock bottom through lack of understanding in the educational system is profound.

attributes.action: Introduce levy on textile garments to fund recycling and end-of-life research
attributes.background: The Government should introduce a levy on textile garments to fund textile recycling centres and also raise money for research into development of new environmentally sustainable fabrics and yarns.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK needs to take responsibly for its textile waste. The UK generates huge amounts of second-hand clothing, much of which ends up being exported to countries where it can have adverse consequences.
 
A levy on textile garments could fund improve recycling in the UK, and also raise money to research and develop new environmentally sustainable fabrics and yarns.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Cancel Tier-2 skilled workers to leave the UK if laid-off due to COVID outbreak.
attributes.background:
Cancel the requirement for Tier-2 sponsored workers to leave the UK if they have been laid-off due to the Coronavirus pandemic by their employer.
Leaving the UK in a such unprecedented situation will have significant impact on their future, the UK economy and UK's skilled worker bank.
attributes.additional_details: Workers have spent a significant amount of time in the UK to create a better future for themselves and contributed to the UK's economy. Many of the employees have been employed straight after their universities and have been in the UK for over 7-8 years. Moving back to their country in such a unprecedented situation will largely impact the UK's economy to sustain with the lack of skilled workers once the economy starts to recover.

attributes.action: Fund a Lunar colony.
attributes.background: Fund and build one or more self-sustainable human outposts on the Earth's moon to act as a staging location for future colonisation of solar system as well as harvesters of Thorium and Helium-3 fuel sources which are abundant on the moon and can be used in Thorium (LFTR) and nuclear fusion reactors.
attributes.additional_details:
With climate change increasing the need for nuclear power as a primary energy source, this government is already investigating modern reactors which use Thorium to increase efficiency, and fusion and LFTR reactors, while still in the early stages of adoption offer greater gains which would justify this course of action in 50 years.

A more human justification is simply that this is the next logical step for our civilisation, and shows that we have faith in our collective futures in the universe.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Create a new law so bystanders have a duty to assist
attributes.background: I believe if you have witnessed a crime where someone has sustained injuries whether it be minor/life threatening and you are able to help you should. If you are able to but choose to video the incident instead or not try to help were possible you should also be liable and potentiality face charges.
attributes.additional_details: There have been incidents including fatal attacks where instead of helping, people who witnessed the crime watched and even took videos, uploading them to social media. In some cases if they provided first aid instead they may have been able to save lives. I personally believe if you don’t help and are able to do so you should also potentially face charges depending upon the severity.

attributes.action: Ban The fireworks
attributes.background: Ban the fireworks
attributes.additional_details: Ban fireworks as they are dangerous and toxic for humans, pets and wild animals , can also cause fire and contribute to the global warming. We must change and be more sustainable.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/626850

attributes.action: Give Health and Social Care staff at least a 20% Discount in fuel.
attributes.background: We need health and social care workers in domiciliary care to receive a discount in their fuel to enable them to be able to travel to their service users without costing them additional money.
attributes.additional_details: I am currently trying to run a small care company and we are struggling to retain staff or get new staff on board due to many reasons and this fuel price rise just tops them all.  It is not sustainable for a small business to function economically without some kind of discount on the fuel.  This will enable us to continue supporting the elderly and others to live safely in their own home.  Otherwise it is likely this will force us and other care companies to shut down.

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about the price of fuel - including any discounts offered - are a matter for retailers, not the UK Government or Parliament.

We have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Set up an independent regulator to monitor and regulate vehicle fuel pricing: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/605282

attributes.action: Create ‘Byways Open to All Traffic’ in Scotland to expand the use of land
attributes.background: Allow the right for vehicles that are taxed, Mot’d and legal for public highway to use existing Byways and unclassified routes in Scotland for leisure and recreational purposes.
attributes.additional_details: In England, Wales, Northern Ireland and the Isle of Man vehicles that are road worthy (Taxed, Insured and Mot’d) can use registered byways for recreational purposes. Byways already in use have rules and regulations to uphold safety and the sustainability of these routes. The majority of those who use these routes take the time and effort to maintain their existence and keep them to a standard available for all to use. An additional option would be to apply a license before the route is accessed.

rejection.details:
Decisions on road access in Scotland are the responsibility of the Scottish Government, not the UK Government or Parliament. The UK Government is therefore unable to take the action this petition calls for.

If you'd like to submit a petition to the Scottish Parliament, you can find out how to do so here: http://www.scottish.parliament.uk/gettinginvolved/petitions/index.aspx

attributes.action: Make cycling infrastructure fit for purpose. Just like we have done with roads.
attributes.background: The national network of cycle paths is piecemeal, chaotic and dangerous, with precious few exceptions. It pits cyclists against pedestrians and inhibits safe and efficient cycling. We need to have a nationally planned gold standard and we need sustained investment.
attributes.additional_details: There are so many reasons. Active travel reduces emissions and noise, and it promotes better physical and mental health. For a relatively small investment compared to road building, we will all benefit.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about current cycling infrastructure, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. The Government is already funding investment in cycling infrastructure, and has produced guidance on cycle infrastructure design, and it's not clear what you want to be done differently.

You can read about Government cycling and walking investment, grant funding, research and infrastructure case studies here: https://www.gov.uk/government/collections/cycling-and-walking

And you can read the Government's guidance for local authorities on designing high-quality, safe cycle infrastructure here: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/cycle-infrastructure-design-ltn-120

We could accept a petition calling for increased funding for cycling infrastructure, or to review Government guidance on cycle infrastructure design.

attributes.action: Turn a third of UK coastal seas into fully protected areas for fish population.
attributes.background:
David Attenborough in One Planet, Coastal Seas (Netflix Series) said: 

“We have far too few marine sanctuaries. We need to turn a third of all our coastal seas into properly protected areas, if we do that, our fishing grounds would recover and help sustain both humanity and the natural world.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK currently has 24% of coastal areas under some form of protection but commercial fishing is sometimes still allowed in these areas. We need to beef that up to 33% and make them fully protected. 

Also recent seaspiracy on Netflix brings to light plastic pollution is over 50‰ down to fishing vessels leaving plastic nets in the ocean which kill far more animals than straws and they make lots of money from this.

https://www.wwf.org.uk/what-we-do/projects/protecting-uk-seas 

So let's do it!

rejection.details:
Ban fishing on a third of UK coastal for fish repopulation
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/553334

attributes.action: Ban all sales of iceberg and glacial water in the UK.
attributes.background: Ban any products which contain ice water collected from icebergs or glaciers.
attributes.additional_details: There are more and more companies using water collected from icebergs and glaciers to sell to the general public. This is absolutely reprehensible with the current issues facing the climate and it should be stopped as soon as possible. We cannot allow companies to bottle up and sell this precious resource as it's not sustainable.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Expand the runway at Southampton airport to save the economy, heritage and jobs.
attributes.background: Help us to make Eastleigh Council see they are making a huge mistake in not allowing the expansion of Southampton Airport. Expanding the airport will allow the airports future to be sustainable while creating 2000 new jobs and allowing better, more fuel efficient aircraft to access the airport.
attributes.additional_details: Southampton airport is a major source of travel for local residents and beyond to access travel to other parts of the U.K. and internationally. Expanding the runway will allow the airport to remain accessible to people’s travel plans whilst creating better routes for destinations, which currently hundreds of thousands currently drive miles to other airports to access. The expansion will make the future of Southampton brighter,cleaner whilst keeping the history of the airport alive.

rejection.details:
This is a matter for Eastleigh Council as the relevant planning authority, not the UK Government or Parliament.

In any case, since you started your petition the Council has granted planning permission to the proposed runway extension at Southampton International Airport. You can find out more about this here: https://www.eastleigh.gov.uk/planning-and-building/southampton-airport-planning-application
